Package gov.nasa.gsfc.spdf.ssc

Class SatelliteSituationCenterRest

  • java.lang.Object
    • gov.nasa.gsfc.spdf.ssc.SatelliteSituationCenterRest
  • @Path("/")
public class SatelliteSituationCenterRest
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements the RESTful Web Service interface to NASA's Satellite Situation Center.
    Author:
    B. Harris

      • VALID_IP_ADDRESS

        private static final java.util.regex.Pattern VALID_IP_ADDRESS
        Regular expression for validating an IP address. It is not very strict (e.g., it considers 999.999.999.999 a valid IPv4 address), but should be good enough to stop malicious values. A good regex for IPv6 is very complicated but the following is good enough.

      • LOCALHOST_ADDRESS

        private static final java.util.regex.Pattern LOCALHOST_ADDRESS
        Regular expression for localhost (loopback) IP (v4 or v6) address.

      • getAllObservatories

        @GET
@Path("/observatories")
@Produces({"application/xml","application/json"})
public jakarta.ws.rs.core.Response getAllObservatories​(@Context
                                                       jakarta.ws.rs.core.Request request,
                                                       @Context
                                                       jakarta.ws.rs.core.UriInfo uriInfo,
                                                       @Context
                                                       jakarta.ws.rs.core.HttpHeaders headers,
                                                       @Context
                                                       jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest servletRequest)
        Provides descriptions of all the Observatories available through this Web Service.
        Parameters:
        request - this request.
        uriInfo - request's URI information.
        headers - request's HTTP headers.
        servletRequest - client request information.
        Returns:
        list containing the descriptions of all the available observatories.
        Since:
        2.2.1

      • createErrorResponseBuilder

        private static jakarta.ws.rs.core.Response.ResponseBuilder createErrorResponseBuilder​(jakarta.ws.rs.core.Response.Status status,
                                                                                      java.lang.String message,
                                                                                      java.lang.String description)
        Create a new ResponseBuilder for an error condition with the given Response.Status and a standard, XHTML entity body.
        Parameters:
        status - HTTP response status
        message - error message. The String will be XML escaped in the resulting XHTML entity-body.
        description - error description. The String will be XML escaped in the resulting XHTML entity-body.
        Returns:
        new ResponseBuilder with the given information.

                                                               java.lang.String message,
                                                               java.lang.String description)

      • createTooManyRequestsResponse

        private static jakarta.ws.rs.core.Response createTooManyRequestsResponse​(java.lang.String description,
                                                                         int retryAfterValue)
        Create a Response for a TOO_MANY_REQUESTS condition with the given description and a standard, XHTML entity body and Retry-After header.
        Parameters:
        description - error description. The String will be XML escaped in the resulting XHTML entity-body.
        retryAfterValue - Retry-After value (seconds). If zero, no Retry-After header will be included.
        Returns:
        Response with the given information.

        Create a Response for a SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE condition with the given description and a standard, XHTML entity body and Retry-After header.
        Parameters:
        message - error message. The String will be XML escaped in the resulting XHTML entity-body.
        description - error description. The String will be XML escaped in the resulting XHTML entity-body.
        retryAfterValue - Retry-After value (seconds). If zero, no Retry-After header will be included.
        Returns:
        Response with the given information.

      • createDbLockedResponse

        private static jakarta.ws.rs.core.Response createDbLockedResponse()
        Create a new ResponseBuilder for a database locked condition with the a SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE status, standard XHTML entity body, and Retry-After header.
        Returns:
        new ResponseBuilder with the given information.

      • getData

        @GET
@Path("/locations/{objects}/{start: [0-9]{4}(((0[1-9])|(1[0-2]))(([0-2][0-9])|(3[0-1]))?)?T((([0-1][0-9])|(2[0-4]))(([0-5][0-9])(([0-5][0-9])|(60))?)?)?Z},{end: [0-9]{4}(((0[1-9])|(1[0-2]))(([0-2][0-9])|(3[0-1]))?)?T((([0-1][0-9])|(2[0-4]))(([0-5][0-9])(([0-5][0-9])|(60))?)?)?Z}/{coordSystems}")
@Produces({"application/xml","application/json"})
public void getData​(@PathParam("objects")
                    java.lang.String objectsParam,
                    @PathParam("start")
                    java.lang.String startParam,
                    @PathParam("end")
                    java.lang.String endParam,
                    @PathParam("coordSystems")
                    java.lang.String coordSystemsParam,
                    @QueryParam("output")
                    java.lang.String outputParam,
                    @DefaultValue("1") @QueryParam("resolutionFactor")
                    int resolutionFactor,
                    @Context
                    jakarta.ws.rs.core.UriInfo uriInfo,
                    @Context
                    jakarta.ws.rs.core.HttpHeaders headers,
                    @Context
                    jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest servletRequest,
                    @Suspended
                    jakarta.ws.rs.container.AsyncResponse response)
             throws jakarta.ws.rs.WebApplicationException
        This is a simplified GET version of the POST getData. Only sub-set of the features available with the POST getData is available at this resource.
        Parameters:
        objectsParam - contains a comma separated list of objects (satellites) for which location data is being requested.
        startParam - contains the start time for which location data is being requested.
        endParam - contains the end time for which location data is being requested.
        coordSystemsParam - contains a comma separated list of coordinate system identifiers specifying the coordinate system of the requested location data.
        outputParam - output option parameter.
        resolutionFactor - SatelliteSpecification ResolutionFactor value.
        uriInfo - request's URI information.
        headers - request's HTTP headers.
        servletRequest - client request information.
        response - response to this request.
        Throws:
        jakarta.ws.rs.WebApplicationException - if an error is detected.
        Since:
        2.2.29

      • getClientLibraryExample

        @GET
@Path("/observatories/{object: [a-z][a-z0-9]*}/clientLibraryExample/{library : (?:(sscws)([Pp]y|[Ii]dl))?(?:,(?:(sscws)([Pp]y|[Ii]dl)))?}")
@Produces({"text/plain","text/x-python","text/x-idl","application/octet-stream","application/xhtml+xml"})
public jakarta.ws.rs.core.Response getClientLibraryExample​(@PathParam("library")
                                                           java.lang.String library,
                                                           @PathParam("object")
                                                           java.lang.String object,
                                                           @QueryParam("mediaType")
                                                           java.lang.String mediaType,
                                                           @Context
                                                           jakarta.ws.rs.core.Request request,
                                                           @Context
                                                           jakarta.ws.rs.core.UriInfo uriInfo,
                                                           @Context
                                                           jakarta.ws.rs.core.HttpHeaders headers,
                                                           @Context
                                                           jakarta.servlet.http.HttpServletRequest servletRequest)
        Gets example program code demonstrating client access to the objects' data.
        Parameters:
        library - client library to use in example code.
        object - observatory/object identifier.
        mediaType - media type value to override what is specified in the HTTP Accept header. A value of "octet" requests "application/octet-stream", "plain" requests "text/plain", "python" requests "text/x-python", and "idl" requests "text/x-idl". If this parameter is absent or has any other value, honor the HTTP Accept header.
        request - example code request.
        uriInfo - URI information associated with this request.
        headers - request's HTTP headers.
        servletRequest - client request information.
        Returns:
        requested example code.
